title: CLAUDE.md
text: shinymcp R package converts Shiny apps MCP (Model Context Protocol) Apps. MCP Apps render inside AI chat interfaces (Claude, ChatGPT, VS Code) using ui:// resources, sandboxed iframes, postMessage/JSON-RPC communication. Key capabilities: - Parse → Analyze → Generate pipeline automatic Shiny--MCP conversion - MCP-compatible UI components (mcp_select(), mcp_text_input(), mcp_plot(), etc.) - Self-contained JS bridge MCP Apps postMessage/JSON-RPC protocol - McpApp R6 runtime class bundling UI + tools - Resource protocol handler ui:// resources - MCP server supporting stdio HTTP transports - Deputy skill AI-assisted conversion complex apps

title: Automatic Shiny App Conversion
text: parse_shiny_app() reads app’s R source extracts structured intermediate representation (IR): parser handles app.R (single-file) ui.R/server.R (split-file) apps. walks AST extract: Inputs: *Input() calls IDs, types, labels, arguments Outputs: *Output() calls IDs types Server body: body server function Reactives: reactive() expressions input dependencies Observers: observe() observeEvent() calls Input refs: Every input$name input[["name"]] reference parser classifies apps complexity:
code: ir <- parse_shiny_app("path/to/my-shiny-app") ir ── Shiny App IR ─────────────────────────────────────── Path: path/to/my-shiny-app Inputs: 4 Outputs: 2 Reactives: 1 Observers: 0 Complexity: medium Input refs: species, x_var, y_var, trend

title: Automatic Shiny App Conversion
text: analyze_reactive_graph() takes IR builds dependency graph: analyzer: Builds dependency graph — nodes inputs, reactives, outputs; edges represent data flow (input$x used reactive(...) used renderPlot(...)) Finds connected components — uses union-find group nodes transitively connected Maps components tool groups — connected component becomes one tool component’s inputs arguments outputs return values Flags unresolvable patterns — dynamic UI, file uploads, download handlers, observers side effects example, Shiny app reactive() feeds renderPlot() renderText() produces single tool group containing related inputs outputs.

text: Start Shiny app list every input output. ’s typical penguins Shiny app: app, identify: Inputs: species — selectInput 4 choices x_var — selectInput 4 variable choices y_var — selectInput 4 variable choices trend — checkboxInput (boolean) Outputs: scatter — plotOutput (ggplot scatter plot) stats — verbatimTextOutput (summary statistics) Reactive logic: filtered_data() filters penguins species outputs depend filtered_data() plus axis/trend inputs Everything connected — one reactive group → one tool
code: # --- Original Shiny app --- library(shiny) library(ggplot2) library(palmerpenguins)  ui <- fluidPage(   titlePanel("Palmer Penguins Explorer"),   sidebarLayout(     sidebarPanel(       selectInput("species", "Species", c("All", "Adelie", "Chinstrap", "Gentoo")),       selectInput("x_var", "X axis", c("bill_length_mm", "bill_depth_mm",                                         "flipper_length_mm", "body_mass_g")),       selectInput("y_var", "Y axis", c("bill_depth_mm", "bill_length_mm",                                         "flipper_length_mm", "body_mass_g")),       checkboxInput("trend", "Show trend line", FALSE)     ),     mainPanel(       plotOutput("scatter"),       verbatimTextOutput("stats")     )   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   filtered_data <- reactive({     data <- penguins[complete.cases(penguins), ]     if (input$species != "All") {       data <- data[data$species == input$species, ]     }     data   })    output$scatter <- renderPlot({     p <- ggplot(filtered_data(),                 aes(x = .data[[input$x_var]], y = .data[[input$y_var]],                     color = species)) +       geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 2.5)     if (input$trend) p <- p + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)     p   })    output$stats <- renderPrint({     summary(filtered_data()[, c(input$x_var, input$y_var, "species")])   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Converting Shiny Apps to MCP Apps
text:
key step. Flatten reactive graph single function: function arguments input values (sensible defaults) function body reactives renderers function returns named list mapping output IDs values plots, render temporary PNG return base64-encoded image. bridge displays element. Important details: Return keys match output IDs: list(scatter = ..., stats = ...) corresponds mcp_plot("scatter") mcp_text("stats"). bridge uses keys route values correct output elements. Base64 plots: Use ggsave() png() + dev.(), base64enc::base64encode(). bridge wraps tag. Text output: mcp_text() renders 
 tag, R’s summary() cat() output preserves column alignment. Default arguments: Every argument needs default value. tool uses loaded initially AI sees expected format. Stateless: reactiveVal(), <<-, session state. tool call recomputes scratch. apps fine since tool calls fast.
code:
tools <- list(   ellmer::tool(     fun = function(       species = "All",       x_var = "bill_length_mm",       y_var = "bill_depth_mm",       trend = FALSE     ) {       data <- palmerpenguins::penguins       data <- data[complete.cases(data), ]        # Filter (was: filtered_data reactive)       if (species != "All") {         data <- data[data$species == species, ]       }        # Plot (was: renderPlot)       p <- ggplot2::ggplot(         data,         ggplot2::aes(x = .data[[x_var]], y = .data[[y_var]], color = species)       ) +         ggplot2::geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 2.5) +         ggplot2::theme_minimal(base_size = 13)        if (isTRUE(trend)) {         p <- p + ggplot2::geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE)       }        # Render plot to base64 PNG       tmp <- tempfile(fileext = ".png")       ggplot2::ggsave(tmp, p, width = 7, height = 4, dpi = 144, bg = "white")       on.exit(unlink(tmp))       plot_b64 <- base64enc::base64encode(tmp)        # Summary text (was: renderPrint)       stats <- paste(capture.output({         cat(sprintf("Observations: %d penguins

", nrow(data)))         print(summary(data[, c(x_var, y_var, "species")]))       }), collapse = "
")        # Return named list: keys must match output IDs       list(scatter = plot_b64, stats = stats)     },     name = "explore_penguins",     description = "Explore the Palmer Penguins dataset with scatter plots",     arguments = list(       species = ellmer::type_string("Species filter: All, Adelie, Chinstrap, or Gentoo"),       x_var = ellmer::type_string("X axis variable name"),       y_var = ellmer::type_string("Y axis variable name"),       trend = ellmer::type_boolean("Whether to show a linear trend line")     )   ) )

title: Converting Shiny Apps to MCP Apps
text: Shiny features don’t MCP App equivalents: fileInput: MCP Apps can’t receive file uploads. Use mcp_text_input() file paths instead, tool read known directory. Shiny modules internal state: Flatten module logic top-level tools. invalidateLater / polling: MCP tools request-response . background updates. JavaScript-heavy widgets (DT, plotly, leaflet): require Shiny’s JS runtime. Use static alternatives (base R plots, knitr::kable tables).
